lines.text: [last lines]
Andrew... remember... be sure and tell them... it was only a bloody game.
It's sex! Sex is the game! Marriage is the penalty. Round and round we jog towards each futile anniversary. Pass "Go". Collect 200 rows, 200 silences, 200 scars in the deep places.
You're a jumped up pantry boy who doesn't know his place!
You said everything was in plain view!
Well aren't I the shifty old sly boots, then.
For Christ sake Milo, they couldn't have made more noise on D-Day.
The bloody glass came out, my bloody boot got stuck and I fell down the bloody ladder.
Well the bloody police must have heard it all the way to bloody Salisbury.
I'm sorry.

We are from different worlds, you and me, Andrew. In mine, there was no time for bright fancies and happy inventions, no stopping for tea. The only game we played was to survive, or go to the wall. If you didn't win, you just didn't finish. Loser, lose all. You probably don't understand that.
Over the years my eyes have been adequately trained to see things for themselves, sir.
It's a good thing, I am pretty much of an Olympic sexual athlete.
Yes, I suppose these days you are concentrating more on the sprints than on the long distance stuff.
Not so dear boy! I am in the peak of condition. I could copulate for England at any distance.
Well, as they say in the Olympics, it's not the winning, it's the taking part that counts.
It looks like you've had it. They're coming up the drive.
Keep them out!
Keep the police out? It's just not done, old boy. But still, I'll try.
Finally, at your moment of dying, you are yourself - a sniveling, dago clown. Farewell, Punchinello!
Please!
[fires the gun]
There are certain skills best acquired in public bars, I suppose.
So I understand you wish to marry my wife.
Alright, I'll do it. Where do you want me to break in?
Not so fast. You've got to get disguised first.
What for?
Suppose somebody saw you coming.
Here? In the middle of nowhere? I could hardly find this place with a bloody map!
You never know. A dallying couple, a passing sheep-rapist.
Whether I love her or not, I found her. I've kept her. She represents me. Once, she was in love with me.
And now she's in love with me. And you can't forgive that.
There's nothing like a little bit of mayhem to cheer one up.
Wit in the face of adversity! Good! You've learned something from the English.

[after tasting]
Caviar, eh? Can't say I like it. Tastes of fish eggs.

[sarcastically]
Fancy.
You're not giving me any kind of a chance, you sadistic bloody Wop!
I hope I didn't hear that correctly...
The shortest way to a man's heart is through humiliation.
Why don't you ask yourself how your man Merridick would go about the search?
Merridew! St. John Lord Merridew!
You're mad! You're a bloody madman!
You are a young man dressed as a clown about to be murdered.
Milo, baby, lemme handle this one, eh? Crime's my baaag. I got this caper worked out ta the last detail!
There it is! The original blunt instrument; the poker. Right!
Now steady...
Where do you want it?
Don't get carried away. It's not a murder weapon you're talking about you know!
No?
No. We're discussing an object from which I receive in the classic formula a glancing blow which will raise a lump without actually cracking the cranium.
Why don't I just keep tapping you lightly on the head with the poker until a lump comes up?

On the morning of his execution, King Charles the First put on two shirts. 'If I tremble with the cold,' he said, 'my enemies will say it was from fear. I will not expose myself to such reproaches.' We must also attempt this Anglo-Saxon dignity as you mount the steps to the scaffold.
Not to appear facetious, sir, but you had better tell that to a judge.

[picking out a possible disguise for the phony robbery]
One black facemask, one black flat cap, a striped jersey and a bag marked "Swag".
Why not a neon sign with "Burglar" on it?
I have nothing against lapsed Catholics. In fact, some of my best friends are lapsed Catholics.
Property's always been more highly regarded in this country than people.
My wife showers. I bathe.
Put that back, please! It's an old Egyptian blocking game. It's taken me rather a long time to get it there.
